PER CURIAM: Â Affirmed pursuant to Rule 220(b)(1), SCACR, and the following authorities: Issue 1:Â  Rule 201(b), SCACR (â€œOnly a party aggrieved by an order, judgment, sentence or decision may appeal.â€); Issues 2, 3, and 4: Summer v. Carpenter, 328 S.C. 36, 42, 492 S.E.2d 55, 58 (1997) (To prevail in a legal malpractice claim, the plaintiff must show she most probably would have been successful in the underlying suit if the attorney had not committed the alleged malpractice.), Steinke v.
